document.docTitle: Cornicola mizuki Ohara & Hayashi 2022, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Recognition of the genera Igutettix Matsumura and Vilbasteana Anufriev (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Typhlocybinae), with discovery of a new related genus from Japan

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Recognition of the genera Igutettix Matsumura and Vilbasteana Anufriev (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Typhlocybinae), with discovery of a new related genus from Japan

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Entomological Laboratory, Faculty of Agriculture, Kyushu University, Fukuoka, 819 - 0395 Japan; Kyushu University Museum, Fukuoka, 812 - 8581 Japan.

subSubSection.paragraph: Body pale yellow to ivory white, and somewhat darkened in males. Head with pair of small black patches, tinged with reddish in dorsal mid-line and antero-laterally in males; face fuscous to black in ventral half in males, brownish to fuscous in lateral margin of frontoclypeus, gena situated between eye and frontoclypeus, and usually anteclypeus and lorum entirely in females. Pronotum with pair of antero-lateral spots fuscous; mesonotum fuscous apically; venter of thorax entirely in males and venter of mesothorax in females fuscous; leg pale yellow with claw dark brown and with male hind femur fuscous. Fore wing semitransparent, with veins dark yellow in males and pale yellow in females; hind wing semitransparent, with veins dark brown in males. Abdomen fuscous with genitalia pale yellow, and subgenital plate fuscous centrally in males, while pale yellow tinged with fuscous dorsally in most of 3 rd ‒6 th tergites and central part of 7 th ‒9 th tergites, with ovipositor fuscous in females.

Head 0.8 times as wide as pronotum; vertex 2.6–3.1 times as wide as dorsal midline, 1.0–1.3 times as long as next to eye, 0.2 times as long as pronotum. Pronotum 1.5 times as wide as long, 1.7–2.3 times as long as mesonotum. Male abdominal sternal apodemes reaching posterior margin of 5 th sternite; female 7 th sternite roundly rectangular, with posterior margin incised near middle, with lateral margin sinuate.
Body length (mean): ♂ 4.0– 4.3 mm ( 4.1 mm ); ♀ 4.5–5.0 mm ( 4.8 mm ).

Male genitalia. Subgenital plates slightly convex centrally, widened subbasally and gradually narrowed apicad. Aedeagus strongly bent dorsad, compressed dorsoapically, bearing 2 short spikes distally (occasionally absent); apical process slender, arched, extending laterally and strongly curved cephalad.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 31–42. Female 7 th abdominal sternite and apex of ovipositor (1 st , 2 nd and 3 rd valvulae) of
Igutettix pulverosus Matsumura
sp. rev. (31–34),
Vilbasteana oculata (Lindberg)
comb. rev. (35–38) and
Cornicola mizuki
gen. et sp. nov.
(39–42). — 31, 35, 39, Abdominal sternite in ventral view; 32, 36, 40, 1 st valvula of right side in lateral view; 33, 37, 41, 2 nd valvulae of right side in lateral view; 34, 38, 42, 3 rd valvula of right side in lateral view. Scales: 0.3 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female genitalia. First valvula of ovipositor with ventral margin narrowed subapically, with dorsal sculpture strigate in apical half. Second valvulae asymmetrical; right valvula with 8–10 strong teeth dorsally, which are small apically and at wider space basally; left one slightly serrated dorsally. Third valvula elongate with apex obtuse.

Remarks. This species has hitherto been found mainly from East Japan , westward to Nagano Prefecture in central Honshu, and isolated in Shikoku of western Japan . Adults and nymphs are exclusively found on table dogwoods,
Cornus controversa
of Cornaceae , inhabit the lower surface of leaves, and adults occur from mid June to late September with a peak period during late July to early August.
Etymology. This species name is derived from the Japanese name of the host plant.
